result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Scott Ihander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**See attached letter file stamped 9-15-15 reducing probationary term to 1 year.**
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: No possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription.

Assessments and counseling as requested by agency.
Provide DNA sample if not already obtained.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Scott Ihander

Defendant Joshua Scott Ihander in court. Prosecuting Atty Kent R. Hoffmann appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bradley J. Schraven in court for Defendant Joshua Scott Ihander.

Ct addresses Def
ADA speaks re: restitution & presents victim's impact statement to court (victim in courtroom)
ADA speaks on Jt recommendation
Firearm rights
Ct arraigns Def on Ct 1 (repeater)
Def pleads No Contest to Ct 1
Plea quest. & WOR
Constitutional rights
No threats or promises
Elements of offense
Clerk to enter plea
Factual basis
ADA speaks on repeater, Def acknowledges prior conviction
Court finds Def guilty of Ct 1, dismisses & read in Ct 2
Victim makes a statement
ADA is heard re: sentencing
Atty Schraven is heard re: sentencing
Court sentence: 2 yrs prison (18 mo IC & 6 mo ES), consecutive to any other sentence, Imposed & stayed, 2 yrs Probation w/conditions:  Assessments & counseling as requested by agency, no possession of alch or contr subst w/o prescription, pay stat. costs + $107 service fee, no additional jail time (served 12 days on probation hold), DNA sample if not already obtained
